jparsec.graph.chartRendering.frame

Class JTableRendering

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.frame.JTableRendering
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class JTableRendering
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    A class to create and manage tables. Implementation and support is just for basic tables, but anyway useful to avoid code duplication.
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Constructor Detail

      • JTableRendering

        public JTableRendering(java.lang.String[] columns,
               java.lang.Class<?>[] classes,
               boolean[] editable,
               java.lang.String[][] table)
                throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a table.
        Parameters:
        columns - The names of the columns.
        classes - The classes in each column. Valid values are numbers (Integer, ...), Boolean and String classes. Set the entire array to null to use String for all columns, or any of the elements to null to use String but letting the value to be parsed to an angle formatted by the methods in Functions or a date formatted in TimeElement.
        editable - True or false to allow or not to edit columns. Set to null to set all to false for String and true for Boolean.
        table - The table, ordered as [rows][columns].
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        public java.lang.String[][] getTableData()

        Returns a copy of the current data in the table.

      • convertRowIndexToModel

        public int convertRowIndexToModel(int viewRowIndex)
        Converts the row index from view to model. The underlying methods of the table component should not be used in this class to convert row indexes, use the methods for this instance.
        Parameters:
        viewRowIndex - Row index in the visible table.
        Returns:
        Row index in the table model.

      • convertRowIndexToView

        public int convertRowIndexToView(int modelRowIndex)
        Converts the row index from model to view. The underlying methods of the table component should not be used in this class to convert row indexes, use the methods for this instance.
        Parameters:
        modelRowIndex - Row index in the table model.
        Returns:
        Row index in the visible table.

      • setRowColor

        public void setRowColor(int column,
               java.lang.String[] values,
               java.awt.Color[] col)
        Sets the colors for the rows.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to use to select the color based on its value.
        values - A set of possible values to select a different color from default.
        col - The set of colors so that in row 'row' col[i] is used when table[row][column] = values[i].

      • setColumnWidth

        public void setColumnWidth(int[] width)
        Sets the width in pixels for a given column at startup.
        Parameters:
        width - The set of widths for each column.

      • setColumnNames

        public void setColumnNames(java.lang.String[] names)
        Sets the name of the columns. No check is done.
        Parameters:
        names - The new names.

      • getSelectedRow

        public java.lang.String getSelectedRow(java.lang.String separator)
        Returns the selected row after a mouse click event.
        Parameters:
        separator - Separator to use for the items in the row.
        Returns:
        Selected row.

      • updateTable

        public void updateTable(java.lang.String[][] stable,
               boolean show)
        Updates the contents of the table.
        Parameters:
        stable - The new table.
        show - True to update the view.
